intro: Epiphorella monolenis, commonly known as the slender epiphorella, is a small, delicate flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Native to the temperate regions of southern Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a short flowering period in late spring, and its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a protected species in several countries.
